description.short: Spectacular tandem skydiving over Mount Snowdon, Snowdonia National Park, and Cardigan Bay - Wales' most scenic dropzone. Currently closed pending Chief Instructor appointment.
description.full:
Skydiving Snowdonia operates from the historic Llanbedr Airfield in the heart of Snowdonia National Park, offering what many consider to be the most spectacular skydiving views in the UK. With Mount Snowdon standing at 3,560ft and jumps taking place from 7,000ft to 13,000ft, you'll literally be flying above Wales' highest mountain.

The location is simply breathtaking. Even the flight up gives you terrific views of Mount Snowdon and the Snowdonia National Park, the coast of Cardigan Bay, the Llŷn Peninsula, and on exceptionally clear days, you can even see across to Ireland. During freefall and your parachute descent, you're treated to unparalleled 360-degree views of this stunning part of Wales.

Llanbedr Airfield has a rich aviation history, historically owned by the military and used as a training airfield for fast jet pilots from RAF Valley on Anglesey. Today it's under the control of Snowdonia Aerospace LLP and serves as a base for various aviation activities including Whizzard Helicopters who offer helicopter tours and flights.

The area surrounding the dropzone is perfect for a weekend adventure. There's a range of local accommodation from campsites to hotels, a café/bistro on the airfield, plenty of parking, and the beaches in the area are fantastic - perfect for relaxing after the exhilaration of your skydive. The coastal towns of Barmouth and Harlech are nearby, along with countless walking trails and outdoor activities.

**IMPORTANT: Due to British Skydiving requirements, operations are currently suspended until a Chief Instructor can be appointed. Check the website or call before booking.**

faqs.question: When will Skydiving Snowdonia reopen?
faqs.answer: Operations are suspended until a qualified Chief Instructor can be appointed - a British Skydiving requirement. Check the website or Facebook page for updates.

faqs.question: What makes Snowdonia special for skydiving?
faqs.answer: You're jumping above Mount Snowdon itself! At 7,000ft+ you'll be higher than Wales' tallest peak (3,560ft) with unmatched 360° views of mountains, coastline, and on clear days, Ireland.

faqs.question: Can I combine this with other Snowdonia activities?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! The area is Wales' adventure capital. Climbing Snowdon, zip lining at Zip World, surfing at nearby beaches, visiting castles - it's perfect for an adventure weekend.

faqs.question: Is the weather more challenging here?
faqs.answer: Mountain weather can be changeable, so jumps may be postponed more frequently than coastal sites. But the views make it worth the wait!
